image.altText: A sign with blue text that says Bedford.

props.synopsis: Creditors have voted to support the sale of Bedford to NDIS provider The Disability Trust, which would guarantee the jobs of 1,100 workers.

title.children: Creditors vote in favor to sell Bedford to NDIS disability provider

image.altText: A police officer uses a metal detector wand on a person wearing a hoodie with their arms up, inside a train station

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Railway Station is the latest location to be declared a public precinct, giving police extra powers to search people or order them to leave.

title.children: Adelaide Railway station joins list of declared public precincts

image.altText: A concept design of a golf course with trees and a city in the background and sunset sky

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has released plans for North Adelaide's public golf course redevelopment confirming that nearly 600 trees will be cut down, not the thousands previously claimed by the Liberals.

title.children: Government reveals golf course tree losses as Liberals revise stamp duty policy

image.altText: Hole smashed in car windscreen.

props.synopsis: Scientists were hoping an object that smashed the windscreen of a self-driving car in October was a meteorite, but SA Museum's investigation says it remains a mystery.

title.children: Object that smashed windscreen unlikely to be anything 'from space'

image.altText: Sand dunes with plants on them and the ocean and a faint outline of a platform on the horizon

props.synopsis: Police say the search for a missing man in the waters off South Australia's south-east coast has ended, but a land search will continue.

title.children: Sea search for missing man off Cape Jaffa ends

image.altText: GettyImages-2252349499

props.synopsis: The Strikers consign the Sixers to 0-2 despite Daniel Hughes taking a one-handed ripper late in the match.

title.children: Strikers win in final over thriller as Sixers star takes classic catch

image.altText: A screen grab of Snicko showing a big spike with the ball not close to the bat.

props.synopsis: Snicko's boss admits an operator error dudded England out of the wicket of Alex Carey on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title.children: England fumes as Snicko operator admits using wrong stump mic

image.altText: Images of English cricketer Harold Larwood.

props.synopsis: Flying fruit pips are less menacing than the cork and leather cricket balls that Harold Larwood hurled at Australian batsmen during the infamous Bodyline series, but a showdown between the English fast bowler and a disgruntled crowd that was allegedly armed with pomegranate seeds is part of the rich story of Ashes acrimony.

title.children: A Bodyline bowler was pipped by pomegranates, and an uproar ensued

image.altText: A composite image showing a woman on the left and a man on the right with a dark background. Both are smiling

props.synopsis: As the political year winds up, Premier Peter Malinauskas and Liberal leader Ashton Hurn have much to contemplate over their Christmas lunch.

title.children: Christmas anxiety, political hubris and an upcoming state election

image.altText: An older man with a santa outfit on standing with a young boy and a woman next to a bin and rubbish truck.

props.synopsis: Mark Mitchell is known for bringing the fun to rubbish collection, donning different outfits and inspiring youngsters to follow in his footsteps. But this week is his final run.

title.children: Beloved outback 'garbo' collects final bins after 45 years on the job

image.altText: A speed-blurred photo of a police car driving under an overpass.

props.synopsis: Two people have been charged with murder after a 62-year-old man was shot dead near South Australia's wine region of McLaren Vale on Wednesday evening.

title.children: Two people charged with murder after man shot at McLaren Flat

image.altText: A screen shot of a Tamika talking to the camera, long blonde hair, flowers in the hair, low-cut dress, crystal chandelier.

props.synopsis: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

title.children: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned

image.altText: Alex Carey looks upwards while holding his bat and helmet after making a century

props.synopsis: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

title.children: Carey king of Adelaide for a day as emotional century saves Australia

image.altText: Two sea lion pups with one draped over the other

props.synopsis: Australia's sea lion population has had a tough winter with rising pup mortalities amid the algal bloom, but dedicated researchers are doing everything they can to help their survival as a species.

title.children: Hope for Australia's sea lions amid more pup deaths

image.altText: A man in a shirt with Aboriginal art on it looks above the camera.

props.synopsis: Malyangapa Baaka Wiimpatja artist Leroy Johnson says the axing of an arts grant, which he is the last recipient of, has left the Broken Hill arts community feeling unsupported.

title.children: 'Not OK': Oldest regional art gallery in New South Wales left in lurch

image.altText: A woman kneels next to a massive washed up ray on a sandy beach with another few dead rays behind her.

props.synopsis: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

title.children: Deaths of rays and sharks blamed on algal bloom

image.altText: A police officer holds a gun while standing at the gates of the Adelaide Oval during the third Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police will be carrying rifles and exercising additional weapon and drug search powers at Adelaide Oval during the Third Ashes Test, following the Bondi terror attack on Sunday.

title.children: Police presence increased at Adelaide Oval Ashes Test in wake of Bondi shooting

image.altText: Merry Christmas Christmas lights on a house.

props.synopsis: With the push of a smartphone button, those watching Luke Denton's Christmas light display in Blackwood can add their own splashes of colour, or even turn the whole thing off.

title.children: Interactive Christmas lights giving children the 'power' from Adelaide foothills

image.altText: A large white truck with SES decals and a boat trailer behind in a car park

props.synopsis: A 67-year-old Victorian man has been found dead, and a 74-year-old Victorian man is still missing in waters off Cape Jaffa after they failed to return from fishing.

title.children: Search for missing experienced fisher after companion's body found

image.altText: A man wearing a dark suit and shirt is sitting and looking directly at the camera. Behind him is a board room table and chairs

props.synopsis: After 13 years serving as South Australia's top judge, Chief Justice Chris Kourakis says it is "an appropriate time to retire".

title.children: SA's top judge Chris Kourakis retires

image.altText: Matt Roberts Albanese pic

props.synopsis: This was a humbled prime minister. Showing contrition, some regret, and an acknowledgement more could have been done.

title.children: Humbled PM shifts gear amid Jewish community anger

image.altText: men in handcuffs face a fence on the  floor as armed police stand behind them

props.synopsis: Officers from the Tactical Operations Unit conducted an operation on George Street in the south-west Sydney suburb of Liverpool late on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Seven men assist police after reports of 'violent act' possibly being planned

image.altText: A soldier crouches down near the back of a tank. The soldier's back is to the camera.

props.synopsis: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

title.children: 'Better than anything Russia has got': Australian tanks arrive in Ukraine

image.altText: a woman walking in front of an old redbrick institutional building with a cane

props.synopsis: Wolston Park closed in 2001, but, for decades, it has been at the centre of disturbing allegations of abuse and chemical restraint. Now, patients' stories have been published alongside a report.

title.children: Patients allege rape, beatings and staff cover-ups at Brisbane mental hospital

image.altText: The Neo robot

props.synopsis: Humanoid robots may be part of our future, but human psychology and the uncanny valley may stand between them and world domination.

title.children: Humanoid robots are coming, but can they win our hearts and minds?

image.altText: A silhouette of Donald Trump with the Truth Social logo behind him.

props.synopsis: The US president's company also operates a number of cryptocurrency-related financial products and owns social media platform Truth Social.

title.children: Trump Media group buys fusion power company for $9bn

image.altText: A graphic featuring a woman with blonde hair, a sign for Philosopher Falls, a fern and a faint map.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer vanished near Philosopher Falls, new discoveries have helped investigators better understand her final movements — though many questions still remain.

title.children: 'We've changed our theory': What recent discoveries say about Celine's last location

image.altText: A close-up of a koala, in a cage in dim light.

props.synopsis: Another week, another quiz. Are you ready to test yourself?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An adventurous koala, a chaotic Lionel Messi tour and a Trump blockade

image.altText: A silhouetted corrections officer walks down a cell corridor in a prison.

props.synopsis: Police will be trusted to decide whether their own conduct was illegal during a secret prison bugging program, with prosecutors saying they will only reassess cases the force flags for review.

title.children: Police to decide on the legality of their own secret prison wiretaps

image.altText: A profile view of a man wearing a black baseball cap and orange hi-vis vest

props.synopsis: An Australian man is sentenced to 12 years in a Bali prison for his role in trafficking cocaine into the country in Lindt chocolate wrappers.

title.children: Bali court sentences Lamar Ahchee to 12 years for role in cocaine smuggling plot

image.altText: Firefighters worked to contain the blaze for around three hours at the Little Street site.

props.synopsis: A NSW oyster grower is left reeling after tens of thousands of dollars' worth of equipment went up in flames just a week away from Christmas.

title.children: Firefighters deem 'ferocious' 30m tall blaze at oyster farm suspicious

image.altText: A middle aged man with a grey beard wearing thick, black-rimmed glasses walking down a street.

props.synopsis: Frederic Pechier's youngest victim, a four-year-old, survived two cardiac arrests during routine tonsil surgery in 2016.

title.children: French doctor jailed for poisoning 30 patients, including children

image.altText: A man with short hair, wearing a button-up shirt and tie as we he walks away from the courthouse.

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory corruption watchdog investigation has cleared senior police officers of misconduct in their decision to arrest and charge Zachary Rolfe, following the fatal shooting of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Investigation clears NT Police of improper conduct in Zachary Rolfe arrest

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt and navy jacket.

props.synopsis: The former member for Dobell, Craig Thomson, has been sentenced to a maximum of four years jail over a migration scheme that netted him $2 million and for fraudulently receiving the JobKeeper payment.

title.children: Former Labor MP Craig Thomson jailed over migration fraud

image.altText: Dan Bongino looks to his side with wide eye, US flag behind, red tie, blue suit. His head is shaved.

props.synopsis: FBI deputy director Dan Bongino will step down from his post next month, ending a short but tumultuous tenure as the bureau's second-highest-ranking official.

title.children: FBI deputy to step down from role less than a year after appointment
